intro: Baskervilla auriculata var. auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate baskervilla, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is native to specific regions in South America. The plant produces bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
